summary: SummaryHighlightsCruelty FreeVeganThe e.l.f. Cosmetics High Definition Powder is a loose setting powder that doubles as a photo filter, blurring imperfections for a soft-focus effect on the skin.
details: DetailsBenefitsReduces the appearance of imperfections & shineLoose powder formulaSheer, natural coverageLightweight wear that won't cake or creaseSifter disperses the perfect amount of product every timeGreat for all skin types100% vegan & cruelty-freeFormulated WithoutPhthalates, parabens, nonylphenol ethoxylates, triclosan, triclocarban & hydroquinoneItem 2500446How To UseThe microfine particles are designed to be used with high-definition camera technology or for everyday wear. Apply powder all over the face for a professional and youthful look of perfection.IngredientsSheer: Dimethicone/Vinyl Dimethicone Crosspolymer, Silica, Sodium Dehydroacetate.
how_to_use: The microfine particles are designed to be used with high-definition camera technology or for everyday wear. Apply powder all over the face for a professional and youthful look of perfection.

reviews.headline: My favorite setting powder.
reviews.comments: Is a fine powder, light enough to dont make you look chalky, it has a little bit of sheen but just enough to give a glow from within. Love it!!!

reviews.headline: The best for satin, radiant finish
reviews.comments:
I was almost out of the elf soft luminescence HD powder and decided to try the halo glow loose powder instead as my replacement. Oh HECK NO. I actually ended up accidentally placing 2 of the halo glow powders in my cart (one pink and the other in light) and will be returning both promptly. They are not even CLOSE to the quality of the HD powder and I honestly hate  them in comparison LOL. 
HD powder: although I do notice a few random specks of glitter here and there, it looks more like the specks transferred to my face by accident from something unrelated vs "I applied glitter makeup to my face". Otherwise, it offers a pearly sheen that looks heavenly radiant. This powder is super finely milled and leaves a velvety soft, silky finish to skin. I've never gotten flashback with the soft lumi color, just a nice, soft, diffused, airbrushed-looking finish. Not drying or cakey to my dry, mature (42 yo) skin. 
In comparison to the halo glow - the Halo Glow loose powder is much more shimmery (almost frosted) and it exaggerated the heck out of any texture on my skin. It also has an almost clumpy/cakey looking texture and left a gummy (???) residue on my skin that felt tacky and seemed to leave me looking at least 14 yrs older. I tried both the pink and light colors with multiple combinations of sunscreens/moisturizers/primers with the same unpleasant results. I cannot get it to work for me. Will be exchanging for the HD immediately!

reviews.headline: Helped with creasing
reviews.comments: I've had issues with my under eyes creasing and this powder definitely helped a lot. I like that it's lightweight. I haven't seen how it looks in photos with flash yet but so far I'm loving this product.

reviews.headline: Love but read before buying
reviews.comments: this makes my makeup look so good but it has literal glitter in it but overall its good

reviews.headline: New favorite
reviews.comments: New favorite - I applied over the liquid foundation Im using and it's beautiful.

reviews.headline: BUY!!
reviews.comments: Now, I will say this..I'm not a professional makeup artist by any chance. I'm pretty okay at it, the first time I used this product I closed itâ€”but last night! Sista, I looked great. Use very little you don't need a lot! I'm darker toned! Get it!!!

reviews.headline: Great product
reviews.comments: Have been using powder foundation for yearssss. Love the finish on this one. Though it appears white, it blends beautifully on my skin at various points of the yeat (with or without a tan).

reviews.headline: does not last long at all
reviews.comments: this is quite literally the worst powder i have ever used in my life. i did my makeup 3 hours ago and set my face. 3 hours later, im insanely oily. not to mention, the glitter in the powder is extremely annoying and you would think that it would be on the front of the packaging in bold letters but no? another thing is the packaging!! it is sooo messy! it gets everywhere and the packaging is soo inconvenient. if you have oily skin or want your makeup flawless or prefer a matte base, this powder is not for you

reviews.headline: Really good but very glittery
reviews.comments: it's chalky at first but after blending better it's not! very nice product!

reviews.headline: elf hd powder
reviews.comments: I love this powder! It blends in great, and doesn't feel powdery or cakey on my skin! I would definitely recommend this!

reviews.headline: Contains glitter!!
reviews.comments: Contains a lot of glitter!!

reviews.headline: I would definitely buy this again!
reviews.comments: Love it! With the history of cheaper products, it's usually poor quality.. BUT THIS!  I love the people that work for ELF now & have brought quality at a great price point! Highly recommend! I apply with a large fluffy brush

reviews.headline: Disappointed
reviews.comments: Did not work for me: settles in creases very quickly. After 1 hour it looks ashy after 2, I have aged 10 years. It just looks terrible on me. It might work better on younger, more hydrated skin.

reviews.headline: Best powder!!
reviews.comments:
This powder did so much for my oily skin. Its blurring, smoothing, and makes my concealer look FLAWLESS.
Buy if you're an oily skin girly!!

reviews.headline: holy flashback
reviews.comments: The powder blurs very well but has shimmer/glitter and gives the WORST flashback

reviews.headline: This is a great product
reviews.comments: When I bake with this powder, I always get compliments on how great my skin looks, no need for filters!!

reviews.headline: YES I WOULD PURCHASE AGAIN
reviews.comments: Leaves a pore less And smooth skin

reviews.headline: Great powder!
reviews.comments: Looks great with a small touch of sparkle

reviews.headline: Good for price
reviews.comments: This is honestly the first setting powder I've ever used but I like it well enough it keeps my face from getting oily as the day goes on. With a better foundation then I currently am using I feel I'd like it even more!

reviews.headline: My absolute favorite powder
reviews.comments: I've repurchased this at least four times, and it's the absolute BEST. I usually use glowy skin and face products, but I don't like the look of glowy makeup, and this gets rid of the extra shine while still leaving a natural healthy look to my skin. As a Texan I need makeup that will last in the heat, and this powder will not budge. My only complaint is I go to school and walk from class to class and the school air isn't the best thing to mix with this powder.

media.headline: Great for dark skin
media.caption: makes my skin flawless and shine free

faceoff_positive.comments:
I had never used elf products before, but I'd been looking for a cheap alternative to some things I wanted to try and add to my makeup routine. This HD powder is beautiful, if you know how to use it right. Yes, it's loose and powdery, so be careful not to tip the container upside down, even closed, or else when you open it there will be a mess. I'd also avoid using the puff it comes with to apply the product, use a complete coverage brush (but keep the puff thing in the box because it helps the powder stay in and not fly everywhere when you open it) It doesn't smell, I have combo/sensitive skin that it didn't bother, and it takes a little getting used to applying it.

It doesn't magically hide all flaws, but I noticed a definite softness to my features, and in pictures I look amazing

Â Also, don't overuse and abuse! I saw a lot of reviews complaining they got a chalky effect, and I did too, after I applied a little too much. Less is more with this product, and trying to focus on the spots you want to soften is a better idea than going for all-over (For me, that's smile-lines, eye lines, and pores).

I have fair skin, so I got the white one, I really love the effect, but for people with darker skin tones, I'd suggest going with the darker colors or risk looking chalky.

Overall I recommend this product, and I was super impressed, especially with the price difference, compared to other things on the market.

Also works great to set lipstick (using a tissue between your lips and the powder).

I've added a picture, sans any other makeup but the HD powder. The left side of my face has it applied, the right doesn't. I can definitely see a softening of my features, and an evening of my blotchy skin tone. Especially under and around my eyes! So ladies, decide for yourselves ;)
faceoff_positive.headline: Love the softness it brings to my face!

faceoff_negative.comments: If you are going to buy this powder be careful when you use it. If you are going to use it at night then great. Any type of harsh lighting or camera flash will give you a white cast where ever you apply it. Specially if you use it over foundation. Also, the thin formula would be great if it didn't create such a mess. You loose too much powder even by opening it. If you have a medium to dark skin tone this will look a little unnatural. You can see the product in the surface instead of being more blendable.
faceoff_negative.headline: elf HD powder + flash photography= DON'T
